dcterms:description: The S&P500 Index is a stock market index that measures the stock performance of 500 large companies listed on stock exchanges in the United States.
dcterms:title: S&P500 Index

dcterms:creator: C. Pérignon
D. R. Smith
dcterms:description: The Historical Simulation (HS) Method is a nonparametric method used for estimating risk measures without making assumptions about the data distribution.
dcterms:title: Historical Simulation (HS) Method

dcterms:description: Monte Carlo Simulations are a statistical technique used to model the probability of different outcomes in a process that cannot easily be predicted due to the intervention of random variables.
dcterms:title: Monte Carlo Simulations

dcterms:description: The Student’s t Distribution is a probability distribution that is symmetric and has heavier tails than the normal distribution, often used in statistics to model data with outliers.
dcterms:title: Student’s t Distribution

dcterms:creator: T. Angelidis
A. Benos
S. Degiannakis
dcterms:description: The AR (1) - GARCH (1,1) Process is a statistical model used to analyze time series data that exhibit volatility clustering, commonly applied in financial markets.
dcterms:title: AR (1) - GARCH (1,1) Process
